definition: beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: They bid farewell to the original suffer hunger and cold days.
sentences.chinese: 他们告别了当初饥寒交迫的日子。

sentences.english: In old society, he was miserable from cold and hunger.
sentences.chinese: 在旧社会，他受尽饥寒交迫之苦。

sentences.english: He suffered a great deal from cold and hunger.
People in the storm-stricken areas suffer from cold and hunger.
sentences.chinese: 遭受暴风雪侵袭地区的人们饥寒交迫。

sentences.english: Cold and hungry, he went back home.
They went to bed, cold and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 他们饥寒交迫的上床睡觉了。

sentences.english: He was cold and hungry after a week on the run so he gave himself up to the police.
sentences.chinese: 他上路潜逃一个星期后饥寒交迫，只得向警方自首了。

sentences.english: I was cold and hungry some of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在这期间，我曾是饥寒交迫。

sentences.english: Before the liberation, farmer is struggling in suffering hunger and cold.
sentences.chinese: 解放前，农民在饥寒交迫中挣扎着。

sentences.english: Many were starving and freezing in this last winter of the long civil war.
sentences.chinese: 在这内战最后的冬季，很多人饥寒交迫。

sentences.english: The explorers were faint from hunger and cold.
sentences.chinese: 探险者们因饥寒交迫而委顿不堪。

definition: lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
hunger cries and cold roars (idiom); wretched poverty
to be without food or clothing (idiom)/to be very poor
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
